author: Maryy Tan
text:
Disclosure: l am a current member of AF BTC and am sharing my personal experience. I am not affiliated with the gym owner or staff. Recent LL post is questionable (as gf of staff J). This gym USED to be my favourite, but unfortunately, things have taken a downturn in recent months. The overall experience has become less enjoyable, primarily due to changes in staff behaviour and management response.
To the management and owner: This feedback is meant to be constructive. Members like myself have provided feedback in the past, but responses often feel generic and unaddressed. Simply directing members to a phone number without real action leaves concerns unresolved.
Here are some of the key issues observed:
1. Member Experience & Capacity: Happy existing members are your best advocates. Smiling ear to ear when signing up new customers is total contrast to sulky cold attitude when help requested by existing customers. Recently, the gym feels overcrowded and noisy, which impacts the workout environment. This has been mentioned in earlier reviews and remains a concern.
2. Cleanliness & Facilities: Toiletries used to be regularly replenished, and hygiene standards were high. Lately, maintenance appears inconsistent. The shower area now has temporary plastic racks on the floor, which adds clutter and feels unhygienic.
3. Noise Levels & Staff Conduct: Music volume is already high, but it is sometimes overpowered by loud conversations at the reception area (staff consistently socialising loudly amongst themselves beyond lunch hours). This detracts from the workout atmosphere.
4. Hygiene Measures: The removal of wet wipe stands has caused inconvenience. Using spray bottles and towels that may not be sanitized adequately raises hygiene concerns. Requests for wipes are often met with a standard ‚Äúout of stock‚Äù dismissive response by Jamie.
5. Equipment Accessibility: Some equipment appears to be stored in restricted-access room. It can be frustrating for members when staff do not readily assist in locating these items. Had a recent bad experience with staff Carmen - unwillingness to help shows in her sulky face.
Lastly, I hope this feedback is taken seriously by the management. The decline in service standards may eventually lead members to seek alternatives. Maintaining a positive, professional environment is key to retaining loyal members.

author: Julia
text:
I've been visiting AFBTC for the last two years since its opening for 3-5 times per week, and the gym management has consistently been great at maintaining cleanliness and equipment upkeep. I've been to other AF gyms across Singapore and I can say honestly that this gym has done a great job creating a friendly and conducive environment for working out.

1. Clean area: The cleaners are here daily to keep the space clean, whether it's mopping the floor or wiping down the equipment as needed. There are self-service antibacterial sprays and cloths in every corner of the gym for us to wipe down after each use as well. The toilets are great as well, definitely cleaner than other public ones nearby (yes I've dropped by the gym just to use the toilet before, because Coronation Plaza's toilet is nasty sometimes).

2. Friendly staff: Employees like Carmen, Jamie, and Nadia have been nothing but helpful every time I ask about something. Not sure what's with the complaints from a couple of recent reviews, but RF gyms including AFBTC are literally the only AF gyms where the staff bother greeting you lol.

3. Equipment upkeep: The equipment variety at this gym has been pretty decent considering the size of the gym, and they have everything I need to get a good workout. Sometimes it's a little inconvenient when a couple of machines are down e.g. the one of the treadmills/lat pulldown machine sometimes goes under maintenance for 1 week, but it's still fairly reasonable. They also add new types of machines every few months, which is pretty nice.

4. Respectful gym members: More than 95% of the folks I've met in this particular outlet have been very polite. I've been to gyms where people interrupt you in between sets - none of this BS here. The staff here take gym etiquette seriously and so do the members. Unfortunately there were a couple of times where someone didn't rerack their stuff after working out - hope those people's pillows stay warm on both sides all night.

5. Extra perks: Members' Days are something to look forward to every couple of days per month - I never really remember when they are but when it happens, it's like a surprise reward for coming down to the gym. The main perk I really love about this gym is the female toilet though. It's always well-stocked with sanitary pads in case of any "emergencies". It goes to show the extra step they've taken to care for their members. I don't know any non-RF AF gyms that do that. Sure, some commercial gyms offer better perks, but they don't offer the same level of convenience at the same price range.

I'm not being paid to write this, and I didn't use chatgpt for this either. I genuinely enjoy coming to this gym, and I hope they stay around for a longgggg time.

author: Darren Tan Wei Jie
text:
Nestled in the bustling heart of one of Singapore‚Äôs most established residential districts, Anytime Fitness Bukit Timah Central offers a reliable, accessible, and community-focused gym experience. As part of the globally recognized Anytime Fitness franchise, this outlet upholds the brand‚Äôs commitment to 24/7 access, cleanliness, and member-centric service‚Äîall within a compact yet efficient workout environment.

One of the biggest draws of this location is its convenience. Situated just minutes from the Downtown Line and easily reachable by bus or car, it caters well to nearby residents, working professionals, and students from nearby institutions. The round-the-clock access is especially valuable in Bukit Timah, where busy schedules and long days make flexible workout timing a must.

Despite its relatively modest size compared to flagship gyms, the space is well-designed and makes smart use of layout. You‚Äôll find clearly defined zones for cardio, strength training, and free weights. The gym is equipped with high-quality Life Fitness and Hammer Strength machines, including treadmills, ellipticals, rowing machines, and resistance equipment. Free weights, barbells, and benches are available and kept in good condition.

What sets this gym apart is its tight-knit community vibe. Regulars often praise the welcoming atmosphere, where members greet each other and the staff know people by name. The trainers are approachable and helpful, offering guidance when needed and available for personal training sessions tailored to individual goals.

Group classes and fitness challenges are also part of the experience, helping to create motivation and engagement. These vary seasonally and may include HIIT circuits, functional training, or community runs. The Anytime Fitness app further supports members with virtual workouts and progress tracking‚Äîuseful for those who prefer hybrid training approaches.

Cleanliness and maintenance are well managed. Equipment is sanitized regularly, and cleaning supplies are readily available for member use. The bathrooms and shower facilities are simple but well-kept, ensuring a comfortable experience even during busy hours.

In summary, Anytime Fitness Bukit Timah Central is a well-rounded gym that excels in convenience, community, and consistency. While it may not be the largest fitness facility in the city, it offers everything you need for effective daily training in a welcoming and no-pressure environment. Whether you're just starting your fitness journey or looking for a convenient place to stay in shape, this outlet is a solid choice in the Bukit Timah area.

I can't say enough positive things about Anytime Fitness Bukit Timah Central. It's incredibly convenient, just a short 10 minute walk from Botanic Garden MRT station. One standout feature is the fantastic music playlist they have. Not only do they play great music, but they also allow members to add their own songs to the shared playlist, something I haven't seen in other Anytime Fitness clubs. This personal touch makes each workout session even more enjoyable.

The staff at AFBTC deserves a special mention. They are incredibly friendly and always greet you with a smile. I had a near miss experience once, and the staff members, Nic and Hyewon, went above and beyond to check in on my well being. It's clear that they genuinely care about providing the best experience for their members.

I highly recommend Anytime Fitness Bukit Timah Central. It's the perfect gym for those seeking convenience, well-maintained equipment, a cozy atmosphere, and a friendly staff who truly go the extra mile. Five stars without a doubt!

author: K T (Kelly)
text:
"Needs Urgent Improvement! Zero Safety, Organization, and Cleanliness"

I've visited three Anytime Fitness locations in Singapore, and this one is the worst.
This is based on about three months of visiting 2-3 times per week. I will be switching to another location from now on.

The biggest issue is that the owner and staff show no signs of wanting to improve.
If you look at the Google Maps reviews, you'll see that most recent low-rated reviews have no reply from the owner. And when there is a reply, it's just a generic "Thank you for your feedback" message. From a user's point of view, nothing is actually improving.

As a result, polite and respectful members are leaving, and only those who need guidance and education remain. That's the real problem.

1. Organization & Cleanliness
Plates are left scattered everywhere after use, and even machine parts are lying around.
Safety bars from benches are not put back, and 20kg barbells lying on the floor seems to be the normal situation here.
The cloths for wiping down machines are always wet and feel unhygienic. I have never seen anyone use them after finishing a machine.
The floor mats near the lat pulldown area are peeling and uneven, which is dangerous. It you cannot fix it right away, at least put up a warning sign.

2. User Manners
Groups of people talking loudly are common (about once every two visits). Their voices are so loud they go through my noise-canceling headphones, which is very distracting.
Also, people do not clean or put equipment back after use. Benches and plates are left out, so the free-weight area often does not have what you need. This means I have to walk between different bench areas to collect plates, which is a waste of time and unsafe.
A bench area with zero 20kg plates? That should never happen.

3. Staff
Staff do greet you, but they do not do enough to keep the gym tidy. Many just sit and scroll on their phones instead of taking action.
They should focus on keeping the gym clean and teaching members basic manners. A few staff pick up abandoned barbells, but most ignore safety and hygiene problems.
Honestly, the owner needs to start with proper staff training.

Bottom line: If you want to train seriously, I do NOT recommend this gym. Go to another Anytime Fitness, even if it's farther away.
